      • getLatestDaysFromNow

        public static String getLatestDaysFromNow(int n)
        build a list of n latest dates from today
        Parameters:
        n - nb days from now
        Returns:
        something like {2014.05.12,2014.05.13} if today is 2014.05.13 and n = 2

        Returns:

      • now

        public static String now()
        Formats the current time in a sortable ISO-8601 UTC format.
        Returns:
        Current time in ISO-8601 format, e.g. : "2012-07-03T07:59:09.206 UTC"

      • toString

        public static String toString(Date date)
        Formats a given date in a sortable ISO-8601 UTC format. 
         
 final Calendar moonLandingCalendar = Calendar.getInstance(TimeZone.getTimeZone("UTC"));
 moonLandingCalendar.set(1969, 7, 20, 20, 18, 0);
 final Date moonLandingDate = moonLandingCalendar.getTime();
 System.out.println("UTCDate.toString moon:       " + PrettyDate.toString(moonLandingDate));
 >>> UTCDate.toString moon:       1969-08-20T20:18:00.209 UTC
        Parameters:
        date - Valid Date object.
        Returns:
        The given date in ISO-8601 format.

      • fromIsoStringToDate

        public static Date fromIsoStringToDate(String isoDateString)
                                throws ParseException
        Throws:
        ParseException

      • toLegacyString

        public static String toLegacyString(Date date)
        Formats a given date in the standard Java Date.toString(), using UTC instead of locale time zone. 
         
 System.out.println(UTCDate.toLegacyString(new Date()));
 >>> "Tue Jul 03 07:33:57 UTC 2012"
        Parameters:
        date - Valid Date object.
        Returns:
        The given date in Legacy Date.toString() format, e.g. "Tue Jul 03 09:34:17 IDT 2012"

      • fromLegacyStringToDate

        public static Date fromLegacyStringToDate(String legacyDateString)
                                   throws ParseException
        Throws:
        ParseException

      • toString

        public static String toString(Date date,
                              String format)
        Formats a date in any given format at UTC. 
         
 final Calendar moonLandingCalendar = Calendar.getInstance(TimeZone.getTimeZone("UTC"));
 moonLandingCalendar.set(1969, 7, 20, 20, 17, 40);
 final Date moonLandingDate = moonLandingCalendar.getTime();
 PrettyDate.toString(moonLandingDate, "yyyy-MM-dd")
 >>> "1969-08-20"
        Parameters:
        date - Valid Date object.
        format - String representation of the format, e.g. "yyyy-MM-dd"
        Returns:
        The given date formatted in the given format.

      • toString

        public static String toString(Date date,
                              String format,
                              String timezone)
        Formats a date at any given format String, at any given Timezone String.
        Parameters:
        date - Valid Date object
        format - String representation of the format, e.g. "yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm"
        timezone - String representation of the time zone, e.g. "CST"
        Returns:
        The formatted date in the given time zone.

      • toCalendar

        public static Calendar toCalendar(Date date)
        Convert the given date to a Calendar object. The TimeZone will be derived from the local operating system's timezone.
        Parameters:
        date - The date to be converted to Calendar.
        Returns:
        The Calendar object set to the given date and using the local timezone.

      • toCalendar

        public static Calendar toCalendar(Date date,
                                  TimeZone timeZone)
        Convert the given date to a Calendar object with the given timezone.
        Parameters:
        date - The date to be converted to Calendar.
        timeZone - The timezone to be set in the Calendar.
        Returns:
        The Calendar object set to the given date and timezone.

      • parse

        public static Date parse(String dateString)
                  throws ParseException
        Parse the given date string to date object and return a date instance based on the given date string. This makes use of the determineDateFormat(String) to determine the SimpleDateFormat pattern to be used for parsing.
        Parameters:
        dateString - The date string to be parsed to date object.
        Returns:
        The parsed date object.
        Throws:
        ParseException - If the date format pattern of the given date string is unknown, or if the given date string or its actual date is invalid based on the date format pattern.

      • parse

        public static Date parse(String dateString,
                         String dateFormat)
                  throws ParseException
        Validate the actual date of the given date string based on the given date format pattern and return a date instance based on the given date string.
        Parameters:
        dateString - The date string.
        dateFormat - The date format pattern which should respect the SimpleDateFormat rules.
        Returns:
        The parsed date object.
        Throws:
        ParseException - If the given date string or its actual date is invalid based on the given date format pattern.
        See Also:
        SimpleDateFormat

      • isValidDate

        public static boolean isValidDate(String dateString)
        Checks whether the actual date of the given date string is valid. This makes use of the determineDateFormat(String) to determine the SimpleDateFormat pattern to be used for parsing.
        Parameters:
        dateString - The date string.
        Returns:
        True if the actual date of the given date string is valid.

      • isValidDate

        public static boolean isValidDate(String dateString,
                                  String dateFormat)
        Checks whether the actual date of the given date string is valid based on the given date format pattern.
        Parameters:
        dateString - The date string.
        dateFormat - The date format pattern which should respect the SimpleDateFormat rules.
        Returns:
        True if the actual date of the given date string is valid based on the given date format pattern.
        See Also:
        SimpleDateFormat

      • determineDateFormat

        public static String determineDateFormat(String dateString)
        Determine SimpleDateFormat pattern matching with the given date string. Returns null if format is unknown. You can simply extend DateUtil with more formats if needed.
        Parameters:
        dateString - The date string to determine the SimpleDateFormat pattern for.
        Returns:
        The matching SimpleDateFormat pattern, or null if format is unknown.
        See Also:
        SimpleDateFormat

      • addYears

        public static Date addYears(Date date,
                            int years)
        Add the given amount of years to the given date. It actually converts the date to Calendar and calls CalendarUtil.addYears(Calendar, int) and then converts back to date.
        Parameters:
        date - The date to add the given amount of years to.
        years - The amount of years to be added to the given date. Negative values are also allowed, it will just go back in time.

      • addMonths

        public static Date addMonths(Date date,
                             int months)
        Add the given amount of months to the given date. It actually converts the date to Calendar and calls CalendarUtil.addMonths(Calendar, int) and then converts back to date.
        Parameters:
        date - The date to add the given amount of months to.
        months - The amount of months to be added to the given date. Negative values are also allowed, it will just go back in time.

      • addDays

        public static Date addDays(Date date,
                           int days)
        Add the given amount of days to the given date. It actually converts the date to Calendar and calls CalendarUtil.addDays(Calendar, int) and then converts back to date.
        Parameters:
        date - The date to add the given amount of days to.
        days - The amount of days to be added to the given date. Negative values are also allowed, it will just go back in time.

      • sameYear

        public static boolean sameYear(Date one,
                               Date two)
        Returns true if the two given dates are dated on the same year. It actually converts the both dates to Calendar and calls CalendarUtil.sameYear(Calendar, Calendar).
        Parameters:
        one - The one date.
        two - The other date.
        Returns:
        True if the two given dates are dated on the same year.
        See Also:
        CalendarUtil.sameYear(Calendar, Calendar)

      • sameMonth

        public static boolean sameMonth(Date one,
                                Date two)
        Returns true if the two given dates are dated on the same year and month. It actually converts the both dates to Calendar and calls CalendarUtil.sameMonth(Calendar, Calendar).
        Parameters:
        one - The one date.
        two - The other date.
        Returns:
        True if the two given dates are dated on the same year and month.
        See Also:
        CalendarUtil.sameMonth(Calendar, Calendar)

      • elapsedYears

        public static int elapsedYears(Date before,
                               Date after)
        Retrieve the amount of elapsed years between the two given dates. It actually converts the both dates to Calendar and calls CalendarUtil.elapsedYears(Calendar, Calendar).
        Parameters:
        before - The first date with expected date before the second date.
        after - The second date with expected date after the first date.
        Returns:
        The amount of elapsed years between the two given dates
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If the first date is dated after the second date.
        See Also:
        CalendarUtil.elapsedYears(Calendar, Calendar)

      • elapsedMonths

        public static int elapsedMonths(Date before,
                                Date after)
        Retrieve the amount of elapsed months between the two given dates. It actually converts the both dates to Calendar and calls CalendarUtil.elapsedMonths(Calendar, Calendar).
        Parameters:
        before - The first date with expected date before the second date.
        after - The second date with expected date after the first date.
        Returns:
        The amount of elapsed months between the two given dates.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If the first date is dated after the second date.
        See Also:
        CalendarUtil.elapsedMonths(Calendar, Calendar)

      • elapsedMillis

        public static long elapsedMillis(Date before,
                                 Date after)
        Retrieve the amount of elapsed milliseconds between the two given dates. It actually converts the both dates to Calendar and calls CalendarUtil.elapsedMillis(Calendar, Calendar).

        See Also:

      • elapsedTime

        public static int[] elapsedTime(Date before,
                                Date after)
        Calculate the total of elapsed time from years up to seconds between the two given dates. It Returns an int array with the elapsed years, months, days, hours, minutes and seconds respectively. It actually converts the both dates to Calendar and calls CalendarUtil.elapsedTime(Calendar, Calendar).
        Parameters:
        before - The first date with expected date before the second date.
        after - The second date with expected date after the first date.
        Returns:
        The elapsed time between the two given dates in years, months, days, hours, minutes and seconds.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If the first date is dated after the second date.
        See Also:
        CalendarUtil.elapsedTime(Calendar, Calendar)
